title: Brother of 15-year-old shooting victim charged in drive-by of 7-year-old
content:
MEMPHIS, TN (WMC) -
A 22-year-old man is accused of planning and carrying out the drive-by shooting that killed a 7-year-old girl. Carlos Stokes is charged with first-degree murder in Kirsten Williams' death.
Kirsten was shot while playing outside on April 10. Earlier that day, Cateria Stokes, 15, was shot in the head as she slept in her bed on Cottonwood Road.
Carlos Stokes is confirmed to be Cateria Stokes' brother; he lived at the same house where his sister was shot.
Another man, who was also arrested in connection with the shooting, told investigators that Stokes planned the shooting and fired the shots.
Three other men are charged in Williams' death two of the men are known gang members.
Jordan Clayton, 21, Branden Brookins, 19, and Carl Johnson, 19, face first-degree murder charges.
